snippet: Emigrant Savings Bank would gain some leeway on capital requirements under a proposed change to the Dodd-Frank regulatory law.
abstract: Proposed change to the Dodd-Frank regulatory law would give Emigrant Savings Bank of New York some leeway on strict capital requirements by changing the date on which a bank's assets are measured; it remains a long shot that the unusual earmark will become a law, however, Howard P Milstein, philanthropist whose family owns the bank, is a big donor to both parties.
lead_paragraph: Emigrant Savings Bank would gain some leeway on capital requirements under a proposed change to the Dodd-Frank regulatory law.

headline.main: Panel Approves Bill Tailored to a Wealthy Donor’s Bank
headline.print_headline: Panel Approves Bill Tailored to a Wealthy Donor’s Bank

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
